qas.question: When did the Russian Caucasus Army advance into eastern Anatolia?
What ethnic group was deported by the Ottoman Government from eastern Anatolia?
How many ethnic Armenians are believed to have died in the Armenian Genocide?
Armenian women and children were deported on death marches through what desert?
Two other ethnic minorities were massacred during Ottoman ethnic cleansing, what were they?

context: <a0_0>In 1915<a0_0/>, as the Russian Caucasus Army continued to advance into eastern Anatolia, the Ottoman government started the deportation of its <a1_0>ethnic Armenian<a1_0/> population, resulting in the death of approximately <a2_0>1.5 million<a2_0/> Armenians in what became known as the Armenian Genocide. The genocide was carried out during and after World War I and implemented in two phases: the wholesale killing of the able-bodied male population through massacre and subjection of army conscripts to forced labour, followed by the deportation of women, children, the elderly and infirm on death marches leading to <a3_0>the Syrian desert<a3_0/>. Driven forward by military escorts, the deportees were deprived of food and water and subjected to periodic robbery, rape, and systematic massacre. Large-scale massacres were also committed against the Empire's <a4_0>Greek and Assyrian minorities<a4_0/> as part of the same campaign of ethnic cleansing.
